com.esri.mo2.map.dpy
Class BaseLayer

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--com.esri.mo2.map.dpy.BaseLayer
All Implemented Interfaces:
Cloneable, Layer
Direct Known Subclasses:
BaseDatasetLayer, BaseGraphicsLayer, BaseGroupLayer
public abstract class BaseLayer
extends Object
implements Layer

This class is a standard implementation of the Layer object. You can sub-class it if you choose. It provides support for parent GroupLayer, LayerSource and visibility.

An utility to find the top-level Layerset parent. This only works if the Layer has been added to the Layer tree

Specified by:
getLayerset in interface Layer
Returns:
the Layerset, null == this Layer is not currently added to a Layerset

getNeedsRedraw

public int getNeedsRedraw(int type)
Description copied from interface: Layer
When the properties of a Layer changes, this method indicates if a redraw of a particular type is required - either features, labels, or selection. Furthermore, it indicates whether a redraw of the Layer would cause overdrawing artifacts to appear - typically as a consequence, a Map will choose to clear the screen and completely redraw all Layers.

Specified by:
getNeedsRedraw in interface Layer
Parameters:
type - is one of the following values DRAW_FEATURE, DRAW_SELECT or DRAW_LABEL
Returns:
one of following values REDRAW_NONE, REDRAW_PARTIAL or REDRAW_FULL

                           int b)
Description copied from interface: Layer
Sets value of NeedsRedraw property for specified redraw type.

Specified by:
setNeedsRedraw in interface Layer
Parameters:
type - is one of DRAW_FEATURE, DRAW_SELECT or DRAW_LABEL
b - one of REDRAW_NONE, REDRAW_PARTIAL or REDRAW_FULL
See Also:
Layer.getNeedsRedraw(int)

setMaximumScale

public void setMaximumScale(double scale)
Description copied from interface: Layer
Sets the maximum scale value above which the Layer stops being visible. Note: "scale" in this context refers to the number of world coordinates represented by a single pixel. You normally obtain this value from the getScale() method of a Map's PixelToWorldTransform property

Specified by:
setMaximumScale in interface Layer
Parameters:
scale - the new maximum scale value
See Also:
Layer.setMaximumScale(double)

clearScales

public void clearScales()
Description copied from interface: Layer
Removes both maximum and minimum scales. Actually, this just sets the minimum to 0.0 and the maximum to Double.MAX_VALUE

Specified by:
clearScales in interface Layer
See Also:
Layer.clearScales()

draw

public void draw(DisplayArea displayArea,
                 int drawPhase)
          throws InterruptedException
Manages scale dependency. When the Map's scale is inside the Layer's scale range, this method calls the drawWithinScale() method which the sub-classes should implement.

Specified by:
draw in interface Layer
Parameters:
displayArea - the portion of a display
drawPhase - one of the draw phase identifiers
Throws:
InterruptedException - if Layer drawing has been cancelled (usually because of a new zoom or pan)
See Also:
Layer.draw(com.esri.mo2.map.dpy.DisplayArea, int), drawWithinScale(com.esri.mo2.map.dpy.DisplayArea, int), isOutOfScaleRange(double)

isOutOfScaleRange

public boolean isOutOfScaleRange(double scale)
Sub-classes overriding the draw method can use this method, to check if the Map scale is appropriate for the Layer's scale range.

Specified by:
isOutOfScaleRange in interface Layer
Parameters:
scale - the scale to test
Returns:
true == scale is outside the scale range and won't draw, false == otherwise
See Also:
draw(com.esri.mo2.map.dpy.DisplayArea, int), Layer.isOutOfScaleRange(double)

isShown

public boolean isShown()
Description copied from interface: Layer
Determines whether the Layer is currently shown in the Map, based on the Layer's isVisible and isOutOfScaleRange properties. Using this method only makes sense for Layers that have been added to a Map. If the Layer has not been added to a Map, then by default this method returns the same as isVisible(). The associated method isOutOfScaleRange(double) is used once the scale has been determined from the Map

Specified by:
isShown in interface Layer
Returns:
true if the layer is shown, false otherwise
See Also:
Layer.isShown(), isOutOfScaleRange(double)

getMapScale

public double getMapScale()
Returns the current map scale.

Specified by:
getMapScale in interface Layer
Returns:
the current map scale

getMapSize

public Dimension getMapSize()
Returns the current map size.

Specified by:
getMapSize in interface Layer
Returns:
a Dimension object.

drawWithinScale

public void drawWithinScale(DisplayArea displayArea,
                            int drawPhase)
                     throws InterruptedException
Sub-classes can implement this method instead of draw() to take advantage of scale dependency management. If you don't want to do it this way, then you should override draw(). This implementation does nothing.

Specified by:
drawWithinScale in interface Layer
Parameters:
displayArea - the portion of the display
drawPhase - one of the draw phase identifiers
Throws:
InterruptedException - if the layer drawing has been cancelled
See Also:
draw(com.esri.mo2.map.dpy.DisplayArea, int)

setId

public void setId(String id)
Description copied from interface: Layer
allows to set up a string identifier for a layer. This identifier might be used in several ways. For instance, it can be used to guarantee uniqueness of a layer in a layer set.

Specified by:
setId in interface Layer
See Also:
Layer.setId(java.lang.String)

getId

public String getId()
Description copied from interface: Layer
obtains a string identifier associated with a layer. setId() method should be used first to sep up the identifier.

Specified by:
getId in interface Layer
Returns:
the identifier or null, if the identifier has not been set up
See Also:
